file_content.text: Doctor Larek? I'm uploading the memory cores now.
Everything looks in order... fascinating. Alarms, new defenses, whole wings of this prison we didn't know about.
I'll forward this straight to Command--see if we can get some of these systems up and running. Thank you.
[You activate the monitoring station terminal and set it to the Republic frequency.]
AG-15, do you copy? AG-16, please respond. Blasted droids... is anyone there?
You don't look Imperial. I think I see a full squad behind you... the more, the better.
Master Jedi! I didn't expect to see robes in the lower levels. Not that I'm complaining.
A Havoc Squad officer. Thank goodness the Republic's finally got some real muscle.
A mercenary? What in blazes are you doing down there? Never mind, I need your help.
Doctor Larek, field research. I'm looking for my droids. They were gathering data that could help us regain control of Belsavis.
Nice to know the scientists are fighting, too.
Glad to have the help.
So much of the history here has already been destroyed. Now we have a reason to preserve it.
I hope you're not down here with them.
Are you safe at least?
Me, against Esh-kha and escaped murderers? Only a fool would go down there... no offense.
We need to push the Empire offworld first.
It'll take more than that.
Half our resources are tied up chasing escapees. If we secure the prison, we'll be at full strength.
Nobody here but me and the Esh-kha.
Haven't seen them.
I was afraid of that. I'm out a few thousand credits if they're lost. But that data's too important.
Tell me about this data.
Science is boring.
Wait, please! You're the only one to answer who didn't bellow Esh-kha at me. I need your help.
We're seeking ancient Rakata security droids. There are many disabled defenses in this prison. These droids would know how to reactivate them.
My droids were to pull their memory cores and upload the data to me, but they haven't answered my comms. They're probably scrap by now.
A lot of droids have survived down here.
You might be wrong.
Please. They were built to gather samples and conduct tests, not survive a war zone.
Can I do something?
Can I do something?
Too bad for you.
You want the Empire to control this place? We're all in trouble if we can't find an edge.
The last transmissions from my droids indicated they had found a vault full of active Rakata security units. Their memory cores were intact.
I've sent the droids' last coordinates. If you could recover those memory cores, we could beef up prison security and push the Empire out.
In that case....
If you say so.
I wouldn't sacrifice my team on a hunch. Those droids were expensive.
Once you find the memory cores, upload the data to this terminal. Good luck out there.
Waste of time. [Refuse quest]
Then please, get off this channel. I need to keep trying my droids.
[This monitoring station appears to be deactivated.]
